FuncDef:
The passive-session udp-port 3784 command changes the destination UDP port number of a specified passive BFD session to 3784.
The undo passive-session udp-port 3784 command restores the destination UDP port number of a specified passive BFD session to 4784.
The default destination UDP port number is 4784 for a passive BFD session.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the peer IP address bound to a passive BFD session.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
According to relevant standards , a passive BFD session uses 4784 as the destination UDP port number by default. If Huawei device interworks with a non-Huawei device that is not implemented according to the relevant standards , run the passive-session udp-port command to change the destination UDP port number of a specified passive BFD session to 3784.
Prerequisites
BFD has been globally enabled using the bfd command in the system view.
Configuration Impact
After the passive-session udp-port command is run to change the destination UDP port number of a passive BFD session, the original passive BFD session is deleted and then a passive BFD session is re-created based on the destination UPD port number of 3784.
